Description: Implement HAIAMM Governance function practices (SM, PC, EG) to establish AI security strategy, policies, and education.
Implement HAIAMM Building function practices (TA, SR, SA) to establish secure AI development processes.
Implement HAIAMM Verification function practices (DR, IR, ST) to establish AI security review and testing processes.
Implement HAIAMM Operations function practices (IM, EH, ML) to establish secure AI operations and incident response.
Establish AI system inventory, identify top risks, establish basic metrics, identify stakeholders.
Create acceptable use policy, map regulatory requirements, define incident reporting, establish third-party AI policy.
Create awareness materials, identify training audiences, build resource library, establish communication channel.
Identify AI threats, map threats to systems, profile threat actors, create basic threat model.
Define input requirements, output requirements, access requirements, and data requirements.
Document architecture, identify trust boundaries, apply least privilege, implement environment separation.
Define review process, create review checklist, establish documentation requirements, implement review tracking.
Integrate security into code review, define review triggers, create issues checklist, establish review documentation.
Perform manual security testing, document test cases, evaluate testing tools, establish results tracking.
Configure issue tracking, define severity levels, document remediation process, establish review cadence.
Apply basic hardening, implement input validation, implement output controls, configure access controls.
Enable interaction logging, secure log storage, document baseline patterns, configure basic alerting.
